value.name: Supervisors blast S.F. for failing to provide drug treatment on demand amid overdose crisis
value.description: Paramedics work to revive an overdose victim in the Tenderloin in San Francisco on Saturday, July 11, 2020 As San Francisco struggles to stem an unprecedented overdose epidemic, elected officials, advocates and people in recovery are arguing the city is failing to provide voter-mandated drug treatment on demand - and are pleading with public health leaders to make it easier to get help.
